answers.answer: Also will it cut years off my life? I'm only 31

Sorry about the diagnosis.  Its a bit frightening. I'm assuming you've been diagnosed with type 2?It doesn't need to be a nightmare.  When I was first diagnosed, I thought life was over.  turns out, some of the changes I went through made me a healthier person.I tend to think that if you go into something with a positive outlook you end up with more positive results.I do know of people who've gotten off of metformin by losing some weight and exercising.  I was NOT one of those people.  I was diagnosed 15 years ago and I go back and forth with my diet....  Not smart."Will it cut years off my life?"  It doesn't have to.  If you don't address the problem it probably will.  Diabetes affects the entire body including the organs.  Just watch your diet, work with your doctor, drink tons of water, exercise, monitor your blood glucose levels often....  You'll be fine.
